optionalFeatureTypes.ADS:ASO: Arcane Dead Shot; Arcane Shot Options

subclass.name: Arcane Dead Shot
subclassFeatures: Additional Arcane Shot Option|fighter|PHB|Arcane Dead Shot|TDArcaneDeadShot|7|TDArcaneDeadShot
Additional Arcane Shot Option|fighter|PHB|Arcane Dead Shot|TDArcaneDeadShot|10|TDArcaneDeadShot
Additional Arcane Shot Option|fighter|PHB|Arcane Dead Shot|TDArcaneDeadShot|15|TDArcaneDeadShot
Additional Arcane Shot Option|fighter|PHB|Arcane Dead Shot|TDArcaneDeadShot|18|TDArcaneDeadShot

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Dead Shot
entries: An Arcane Dead Shot studies and modify a unique method of elven archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. These elven techniques have been altered to suit the needs of a variety of races and cultures that aren't as fixated with bows, allowing these fighters to turn any kind of ammunition into a vessel for magic that harms and debilitates their enemies. Requiring both a mastery of ranged combat and an understanding of the arcane arts, Arcane Dead Shot stand out as versatile and effective sharpshooters.

entries.subclassFeature: Arcane Dead Shot Lore|fighter|PHB|Arcane Dead Shot|TDArcaneDeadShot|3|TDArcaneDeadShot

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Dead Shot Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature—typical for practitioners of this elven martial tradition. You choose to gain proficiency in either the {@skill Arcana} or the {@skill Nature} skill, and you choose to learn either the {@spell prestidigitation} or the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see 'Arcane Shot Options' below) and when you attack with a weapon that uses ammunition, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Dexterity.

Once per turn when you fire an ammunition from a ranged weapon as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that ammunition. You decide to use the option when the ammunition hits a creature, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You have 1 use of each option, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th. Each option also improves when you become a 10th and 18th-level fighter.
If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC equals:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.

items.name: Banishing Shot
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target from this plane. If the shot hits a creature, the target must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, its speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 10th level in this class, a target also takes {@dice 1d6} force damage when the ammunition hits it and the damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at 18th level.

items.name: Beguiling Shot
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this shot to temporarily beguile its target. Choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The creature hit by the ammunition takes an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it is {@condition charmed} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition charmed} target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw.
The attack and psychic damage can be non-lethal
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 3d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and {@dice 4d6} at 18th level.

items.name: Bursting Shot
entries: You imbue your shot with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the shot hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 15 feet of it take {@dice 2d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@dice 3d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and {@dice 4d6} at 18th level.

items.name: Enfeebling Shot
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your shot. The creature hit by the shot takes an extra {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks or magical effects is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@dice 3d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and {@dice 4d6} at 18th level.

items.name: Grasping Shot
entries: When this shot strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the shot takes an extra {@dice 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@dice 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves or is moved 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this arcane shot option again.
The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to {@dice 3d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and {@dice 4d6} at 18th level.

items.name: Piercing Shot
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your shot an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the shot fires forward in a line that is 1 foot wide and 60 feet long, before disappearing. The shot passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes damage as if it were hit by the shot, plus an extra {@dice 1d6} force damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
When you reach 10th level in this subclass the range increases to 120 feet. At 18th level the force damage increases to {@dice 2d6}.

items.name: Seeking Shot
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your ammunition the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The ammunition flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the ammunition to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the ammunition disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the ammunition, plus an extra separate {@dice 1d6} of the weapons damage type, and you learn the target's location for the next 8 hours. On a successful save, the target takes half as much weapon damage, no extra damage and you don't learn its location.
The extra weapon damage impacts again for another {@dice 1d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and a total of three times at 18th level.

items.name: Shadow Shot
entries: You weave illusion magic into your ammunition, causing it to occlude your foe's vision while they are disoriented by strange sounds. The creature hit by the ammunition takes an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see or hear anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 3d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and {@dice 4d6} at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn how to direct an errant shot toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magical piece of ammunition and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 7th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 10th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 15th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: At 18th level, you learn another Arcane Shot option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Ready Shot
entries: Starting at 15th level, your arcane shot will be available in the most difficult moments of combat. You have two uses of each shot and regain both on a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Shot
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target from this plane. If the shot hits a creature, the target must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, its speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 10th level in this class, a target also takes {@dice 1d6} force damage when the ammunition hits it and the damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at 18th level.

This shot and it's ammunition can deal non-lethal damage.
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 3d6} when you reach 10th level in this class and {@dice 4d6} at 18th level.
